EMPLOYMENT AGREEMENT

This Employment Agreement (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of June 1, 2023 (the “Effective Date”), by and between GlobalTech Solutions Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal office located at 1234 Main Street, Suite 500, Wilmington, DE 19801 (“Employer”), and Jordan A. Smith, an individual with a mailing address of 789 Elm Street, Apt 2B, Metropolis, NY 10118 (“Employee”). Employer and Employee are sometimes collectively referred to herein as the “Parties” and individually as a “Party.”

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Employer is engaged in the business of developing, marketing, and selling advanced technology products and related services;

WHEREAS, Employee possesses specialized skills and expertise that are valuable to Employer’s business objectives; and

WHEREAS, Employer desires to employ Employee, and Employee desires to accept such employment, subject to the terms and conditions contained herein;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and promises, and other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS
   1.1 “Confidential Information” means any information, whether written or oral or in any other form, that is disclosed by one Party (the “Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (the “Receiving Party”) that is designated as confidential or should reasonably be understood to be confidential given the nature of the information and the circumstances of disclosure. Confidential Information includes, without limitation, business strategies, technology and product plans, financial information, customer lists, pricing, and proprietary software or inventions. Confidential Information does not include information that (i) is or becomes a matter of public knowledge through no fault of the Receiving Party; (ii) was in the Receiving Party’s lawful possession prior to the disclosure; (iii) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to the Disclosing Party’s Confidential Information; or (iv) is required to be disclosed by law.
   1.2 “Employment Period” shall mean the period during which Employee’s services are retained by Employer and any extensions thereof in accordance with Section 7 herein.
   1.3 “Job Description” means the position description attached hereto as Exhibit A, which describes Employee’s responsibilities, reporting relationships, and performance expectations.
   1.4 “Intellectual Property” means all inventions, discoveries, designs, works of authorship, improvements, trade secrets, know-how, and other proprietary rights, regardless of patent, copyright, trademark, or other legal protection, whether or not protectible by intellectual property laws.
   1.5 “Policies” means all employer policies, procedures, and guidelines adopted by Employer from time to time, as may be amended, supplemented, or terminated, including without limitation those with respect to code of conduct, technology usage, harassment, and discrimination.
   1.6 “Notice Period” means the period of thirty (30) days that the requesting Party must provide to the other Party pursuant to Section 8 (Termination) of this Agreement.

2. EMPLOYMENT, DUTIES, AND LOCATION
   2.1 Employment. Employer hereby agrees to employ Employee, and Employee hereby accepts such employment, on the terms and conditions set forth in this Agreement. The employment relationship created by this Agreement is at-will, meaning that either Party may terminate the relationship at any time pursuant to Section 8, with or without cause or prior notice, except as otherwise provided herein.
   2.2 Title and Position. Employee shall serve as Senior Technology Consultant. Employee’s duties shall include, but not be limited to, providing strategic technological advice, leading project teams, developing innovative solutions for the product roadmap, and consulting with management regarding technology trends and competitive positioning. Employee agrees to diligently perform all duties assigned by Employer consistent with the Job Description attached as Exhibit A.
   2.3 Work Location. Employee’s primary work location shall be Employer’s headquarters at the address set forth in the preamble herein. Employee may be required, as reasonably necessary, to travel or temporarily relocate to other locations as part of the job responsibilities. Any such travel or temporary relocation shall be subject to Employer’s travel policies and reimbursement procedures.
   2.4 Time, Effort, and Best Efforts. Employee agrees to devote the necessary time, skill, and attention to perform Employee’s duties efficiently and diligently. Employee shall adhere to all working hours and attendance requirements specified by Employer and shall make best efforts to meet performance standards as set forth by Employer and the applicable Job Description.

3. TERM OF EMPLOYMENT
   3.1 Employment Period. The employment term pursuant to this Agreement shall commence on June 1, 2023 (the “Commencement Date”) and shall continue until terminated by either Party in accordance with Section 8 below (“Employment Period”).
   3.2 Renewal and Extension. The Parties may agree to extend or renew the employment arrangement in writing, with any such extension subject to adjustment of compensation or changes in job responsibilities as mutually agreed upon by the Parties in writing.
   3.3 Probationary Period. For the first ninety (90) days of employment, Employee’s performance shall be subject to review, and Employer reserves the right to modify Employee’s terms of employment or terminate this Agreement if performance does not meet established standards. During the probationary period, the at-will employment nature of this Agreement shall remain unaffected.

4. COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS
   4.1 Base Salary.
       (a) Employer shall pay Employee an annual base salary of $120,000, payable in equal bi-weekly installments, subject to standard payroll deductions and applicable tax withholdings. 
       (b) Payment shall be made in U.S. dollars on each regular Payroll Date. The payment schedule shall be consistent with Employer’s payroll procedures.
   4.2 Bonus Eligibility. Employee may be eligible to receive an annual performance bonus, with the amount, criteria, and terms of such bonus determined solely by Employer at its discretion. Any bonus paid shall be subject to withholdings as required by law.
   4.3 Benefits. During the Employment Period, Employee shall be eligible to participate in Employer’s benefit plans, which may include but are not limited to health insurance, dental and vision plans, retirement savings plans, paid time off, and life insurance, subject to all terms and conditions of such benefit plans and Employer’s Policies. Participation in any benefit plan is contingent upon submission of requisite documentation and compliance with plan eligibility rules.
   4.4 Expense Reimbursement. Employer shall reimburse Employee for all reasonable and documented business-related expenses incurred in the performance of Employee’s duties in accordance with Employer’s reimbursement policies. Such expenses include travel, lodging, meals, and incidentals, subject to prior approval by Employee’s supervisor where required. Reimbursement shall be processed on the next regular payroll cycle following submission of receipts or documentation as may be required.
   4.5 Equity Compensation. Provided Employee meets performance criteria and as further detailed in the Employer Equity Compensation Plan, Employee may be eligible for equity awards. The specific terms of any equity award shall be set forth in a separate award agreement, and all such awards shall be subject to Employer Board approval, as well as the terms and conditions of the applicable plan documents.

5. WORK SCHEDULE, LEAVE, AND TIME OFF
   5.1 Standard Work Hours. Employee is expected to work a minimum of forty (40) hours per week during normal business hours of Employer. Employee may be required to work additional hours to fulfill the responsibilities of the position. Overtime, if applicable, shall be compensated in accordance with federal, state, or local law.
   5.2 Paid Time Off (PTO). Employee shall be entitled to accrue PTO in accordance with Employer’s policies. Accrual rates, usage, and carryover limits shall be defined in the Employer Employee Handbook and any amendments thereto. PTO must be scheduled and taken by mutual agreement with Employer, subject to business needs.
   5.3 Holidays. Employee shall be entitled to observe Employer-designated holidays. Employer reserves the right to modify or change the list of paid holidays in its sole discretion and in accordance with the applicable plans announced to employees.
   5.4 Sick Leave and Family Leave. Employee shall be eligible for sick leave, family leave, and other related leave in accordance with applicable federal and state law and Employer’s Policies. Employer shall provide notice regarding such policies and any updates thereon.
   5.5 Remote Work and Flexible Scheduling. Employer may, at its discretion, grant Employee a modified work schedule or remote work arrangements. Such arrangements, if granted, shall be documented in writing and shall not modify the at-will nature of Employee’s employment as described in Section 2.1.

6. CONFIDENTIALITY, INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY, AND NONDISCLOSURE
   6.1 Confidentiality Obligations. Employee agrees to maintain in strict confidence and not to disclose or use, except in performance of Employee’s duties hereunder, any Confidential Information of Employer as defined in Section 1.1. This obligation shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
   6.2 Ownership of Intellectual Property.
       (a) During the Employment Period, Employee agrees that any and all inventions, developments, improvements, methods, or works of authorship (collectively “Developments”) conceived or made by Employee, solely or jointly, which relate in any way to Employer’s business (or research and development) or that result from tasks assigned to Employee, shall be the exclusive property of Employer.
       (b) Employee hereby assigns, and agrees to assign, to Employer all rights, title, and interest in and to such Developments, including all Intellectual Property rights therein, and agrees to cooperate with Employer in obtaining and enforcing such rights.
   6.3 Return of Materials. Upon termination of Employee’s employment, or upon Employer’s request at any time during the Employment Period, Employee shall immediately return to Employer any and all property, documents, or materials containing or embodying Confidential Information or any other proprietary information of Employer.
   6.4 Non-Solicitation and Non-Competition.
       (a) During the Employment Period and for a period of twelve (12) months thereafter, Employee shall not, directly or indirectly, solicit any employee or contractor of Employer to terminate or modify their relationship with Employer.
       (b) Employee acknowledges that the restrictions set forth in this Section 6.4 are reasonable and necessary to protect Employer’s proprietary interests and confidential information. Should any provision be deemed unenforceable in a particular jurisdiction, the remaining provisions shall continue in full force and effect.
   6.5 Public Announcements. No Party shall make any public statement or press release regarding the existence or terms of this Agreement without the prior written consent of the other Party, except as may be required by applicable law or regulation.

7. DISPUTE RESOLUTION AND GOVERNING LAW
   7.1 Informal Resolution. In the event of any dispute or claim arising out of or relating in any way to this Agreement or the Employment Period, the Parties shall first attempt to resolve the dispute through informal discussions conducted within thirty (30) days of the dispute’s emergence.
   7.2 Mediation. Should informal resolution prove unsuccessful, the Parties agree to submit the dispute to non-binding mediation in accordance with rules established by a mutually agreed-upon mediator. Both Parties agree to participate in good faith and to share equally the costs associated with mediation.
   7.3 Arbitration. If the dispute remains unresolved following mediation, the Parties agree that the dispute shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration administered by the American Arbitration Association (“AAA”) under its Employment Arbitration Rules. The arbitration shall take place in Wilmington, Delaware, unless the Parties mutually agree to another location. Judgment upon the award rendered by the arbitrator may be entered in any court of competent jurisdiction.
   7.4 Governing Law. This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of Delaware without regard to its conflict of laws provisions.
   7.5 Attorneys’ Fees. In any action or proceeding arising from this Agreement, the prevailing party shall be entitled to recover its reasonable attorneys’ fees and costs in addition to any other relief to which it may be entitled.
   7.6 Survival of Provisions. The provisions of Sections 6 (Confidentiality, Intellectual Property and Non-Disclosure), 7 (Dispute Resolution and Governing Law), and 9 (General Provisions) shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

8. TERMINATION
   8.1 Termination by Employer.
       (a) Employer may terminate Employee’s employment at any time with or without cause upon providing Employee with a Notice Period of thirty (30) days. During this Notice Period, Employee shall continue to diligently perform Employee’s duties unless instructed otherwise.
       (b) Notwithstanding Section 8.1(a), Employer may immediately terminate this Agreement for cause. “Cause” is defined to include, without limitation: (i) gross misconduct; (ii) material breach of this Agreement or Employer Policies; (iii) willful neglect of duties; or (iv) any act of dishonesty or fraud that adversely affects Employer’s business or reputation.
   8.2 Termination by Employee.
       (a) Employee may terminate this Agreement at any time by providing Employer with at least thirty (30) days’ prior written notice. During such notice period, Employee shall continue to perform Employee’s job responsibilities and shall cooperate with Employer in the orderly transition of duties.
       (b) Employer reserves the right to waive any portion of the Notice Period in its sole discretion.
   8.3 Termination for Disability or Death. In the event Employee is unable to perform the essential functions of the position due to a disability for a period exceeding ninety (90) consecutive days, or in the event of Employee’s death, this Agreement and Employee’s employment shall terminate automatically, subject to applicable law and continuation of benefits requirements.
   8.4 Effect of Termination.
       (a) Upon termination of this Agreement for any reason, Employee shall immediately cease to represent Employee as an agent or representative of Employer.
       (b) Employee shall be entitled only to those compensation and benefits accrued through the effective date of termination, subject to the accrual and payment policies set forth in this Agreement and Employer’s benefit plans.
       (c) Sections 1, 6, 7, 8.4, and 9 shall survive the termination of this Agreement.

9. GENERAL PROVISIONS
   9.1 Entire Agreement. This Agreement, along with Exhibit A and any documents referenced herein, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties and supersedes all prior or contemporaneous agreements or understandings, whether written or oral, relating to the subject matter hereof.
   9.2 Amendments. No modification or amendment to this Agreement shall be valid or binding unless made in writing and signed by duly authorized representatives of both Parties.
   9.3 Waiver. The failure of either Party to enforce any provision of this Agreement shall not be deemed a waiver of future enforcement of that or any other provision. No waiver of any provision of this Agreement shall be effective unless in writing and signed by the Party waiving such right.
   9.4 Severability. If any term or provision of this Agreement is determined to be invalid, illegal, or unenforceable in any respect, the remaining provisions shall remain in full force and effect and shall be construed so as to effectuate the intent of the Parties.
   9.5 Notices. All notices, requests, consents, claims, demands or other communications hereunder shall be in writing. Notices shall be deemed to have been duly given when delivered personally, sent by facsimile (with confirmation of transmission), or mailed by certified mail, return receipt requested, postage prepaid. Notice to Employer shall be addressed to its principal office as stated in the preamble, and notice to Employee shall be sent to the Employee’s address as set forth in the preamble, or to such other address as may be designated by either Party by written notice.
   9.6 Assignment. Employee may not assign or delegate any rights or obligations under this Agreement without Employer’s prior written consent. Employer may assign this Agreement to any successor in interest or affiliate without Employee’s consent.
   9.7 Relationship of the Parties. Nothing in this Agreement shall be construed as creating a partnership, joint venture, agency, or employment relationship other than the at-will employment relationship expressly set forth herein.
   9.8 Counterparts. This Agreement may be executed in one or more counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original, but all of which together shall constitute one and the same instrument.
   9.9 Headings. The headings used in this Agreement are for convenience only and shall not affect the interpretation of any provision.
   9.10 Survival. The provisions regarding Confidentiality, Intellectual Property, Non-Disclosure, Governing Law, Dispute Resolution, and any other provisions which by their nature are intended to survive termination of employment shall survive termination of this Agreement.
   9.11 No Third-Party Beneficiaries. This Agreement is intended solely for the benefit of the Parties and their respective successors and permitted assigns, and nothing herein is intended to confer any rights or remedies upon any other person or entity.
   9.12 Electronic Execution. This Agreement and any documents executed in connection herewith may be signed electronically, and such electronic signatures shall have the same force and effect as an original signature.
   9.13 Force Majeure. Neither Party shall be liable for any delay or default in the performance of any obligation hereunder arising from causes beyond its reasonable control, including but not limited to acts of God, fire, flood, earthquakes, war, terrorism, governmental regulations, or acts of any governmental authority.

10. MISCELLAN

PROFESSIONAL SERVICES AGREEMENT

This Professional Services Agreement (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of June 1, 2023 (“Effective Date”), by and between Apex Solutions, Inc., a Delaware corporation with its principal place of business at 100 Business Park Drive, Wilmington, DE 19801 (“Service Provider”), and ClearPath Enterprises, LLC, a New York limited liability company with its principal place of business at 500 Commerce Street, New York, NY 10001 (“Client”). Service Provider and Client are sometimes individually referred to as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Client desires to engage Service Provider to provide certain professional services as described hereunder; and

WHEREAS, Service Provider represents that it possesses the requisite expertise, resources, and ability to perform such professional services; and

WHEREAS, the Parties intend to set forth their respective rights and obligations in connection with the professional services to be provided;

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and agreements contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS
   1.1 “Agreement Documents” means this Agreement, any exhibits, schedules, statements of work (“SOW”), addenda, or amendments hereto, all of which are incorporated herein by reference.
   1.2 “Confidential Information” means all non-public information disclosed by one Party (“Disclosing Party”) to the other Party (“Receiving Party”), either directly or indirectly, in any form, including but not limited to business plans, technical data, financial information, client lists, or trade secrets, that is designated as confidential or that reasonably should be understood to be confidential.
   1.3 “Deliverables” means the tangible and intangible work product created or developed by Service Provider pursuant to a SOW pursuant to Section 3.3.
   1.4 “Force Majeure Event” means any event beyond the reasonable control of a Party, including but not limited to acts of God, epidemics, fires, floods, war, terrorism, civil commotion, governmental restrictions, strikes, or shortages of materials which prevents the performance, in whole or in part, of any obligation under this Agreement.
   1.5 “Services” means the professional services, consultations, and deliverables described in each applicable SOW.
   1.6 “Term” means the duration of this Agreement as described in Section 8 herein.
   1.7 “Work Product” includes all data, materials, writings, software, inventions, and other information developed by Service Provider in connection with providing the Services.

2. SCOPE OF SERVICES
   2.1 Engagement. Client hereby engages Service Provider, and Service Provider hereby accepts such engagement, to provide the Services as specifically described in each SOW executed under this Agreement.
   2.2 Statements of Work. The Parties shall define the scope, fees, deliverables, milestones, timelines, and other pertinent details for each project via a separate SOW. Each SOW shall be governed by all terms and conditions of this Agreement and shall be subject to modification only by written instrument executed by authorized representatives of both Parties.
   2.3 Modifications. Any modification, amendment, or supplement to any SOW or to this Agreement shall be effective only if in writing and signed by duly authorized officers of both Parties. No waiver by either Party of any breach or default shall be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach or default.
   2.4 Professional Standards. Service Provider shall perform the Services using a level of skill, care, and diligence consistent with prevailing industry standards and in full compliance with all applicable laws, rules, and regulations.

3. DELIVERABLES AND SERVICE PERFORMANCE
   3.1 Service Provider Obligations. Service Provider shall (a) supply all necessary labor, technical personnel, materials, equipment, and resources as required to perform the Services; (b) communicate regularly with Client regarding the progress of the Services; (c) meet the milestones and deliverables as set forth in the applicable SOW; and (d) ensure that the Deliverables conform to the specifications and requirements in the applicable SOW.
   3.2 Client Obligations. Client shall (a) cooperate with Service Provider by providing necessary information, access, and personnel as reasonably required; (b) designate a project manager to serve as the primary point of contact; (c) review and approve Deliverables within the timelines agreed upon in the applicable SOW; and (d) provide written feedback or instructions regarding any required revisions to the Deliverables.
   3.3 Acceptance Criteria. Each Deliverable shall be deemed accepted by Client upon (i) delivery and written notification of acceptance by authorized Client personnel, or (ii) if no written notice of non-acceptance is received by Service Provider within ten (10) business days of delivery provided that any deviations from the agreed specification have been properly communicated.
   3.4 Timelines. Service Provider shall use commercially reasonable efforts to observe the schedule specified in the applicable SOW. If a delay occurs due to a Force Majeure Event or Client's failure to timely provide required cooperation, the timeline may be adjusted by mutual written agreement.

4. FEES, PAYMENT, AND EXPENSES
   4.1 Fees. In consideration for the Services, Client shall pay Service Provider the fees specified in each SOW (“Fees”). All Fee amounts and terms shall be clearly set forth within the relevant SOW, and are incorporated herein by reference.
   4.2 Invoicing and Payment. Service Provider shall issue invoices as provided in each SOW. Client shall pay all undisputed invoices within thirty (30) days of the invoice date. If not otherwise agreed, the currency of payment shall be U.S. Dollars.
   4.3 Late Payments. Any amounts not paid when due shall accrue interest at a rate of one and one-half percent (1.5%) per month, or the maximum rate permitted by applicable law, whichever is lower, until fully paid. In the event of Client’s late payment, Service Provider may suspend performance of the Services until payment is received.
   4.4 Taxes. All Fees are exclusive of applicable taxes. Client is responsible for paying all taxes, levies, or duties imposed by any taxing authority based on the amounts paid hereunder, excluding taxes imposed on Service Provider’s net income.
   4.5 Expenses. Unless otherwise provided in a SOW, Client shall reimburse Service Provider for reasonable and pre-approved out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with providing the Services. All reimbursable expenses shall be supported by documentation acceptable to Client.

5. CONFIDENTIALITY AND INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
   5.1 Confidentiality Obligations.
       5.1.1 Each Party agrees that it shall: (a) use the Confidential Information solely for purposes of fulfilling its obligations under this Agreement; (b) not disclose Confidential Information to any third-party without the prior written consent of the Disclosing Party; and (c) take all necessary precautions to protect the confidentiality of the Confidential Information.
       5.1.2 The obligations in this Section shall not apply to information which (a) is or becomes publicly available without breach of this Agreement; (b) is rightfully received from a third party without an obligation of confidentiality; (c) is independently developed by the Receiving Party without use of or reference to Confidential Information; or (d) is required to be disclosed by law or by a governmental authority, provided that the Receiving Party gives prompt written notice of such requirement to the Disclosing Party.
   5.2 Intellectual Property Rights.
       5.2.1 Service Provider Ownership. Service Provider retains all right, title, and interest in and to any of its pre-existing intellectual property or any modifications or enhancements thereto that are not specifically created for Client as part of the Deliverables.
       5.2.2 Client Ownership. Client shall own all right, title, and interest in and to any deliverables, work product, or other materials created for Client under a SOW, subject to and including Service Provider’s underlying intellectual property rights.
       5.2.3 License to Service Provider. To the extent necessary for the performance of Services and delivery of Deliverables, Client hereby grants Service Provider a non-exclusive, royalty-free license to use Client’s intellectual property solely for such purposes.
   5.3 Third-Party Materials. In the event that any Deliverable contains third-party materials, the Parties shall secure the necessary rights and licenses to use and distribute such materials. Service Provider shall notify Client of any such third-party materials and shall ensure that no intellectual property infringement occurs.

6. WARRANTIES, REPRESENTATIONS, AND INDEMNIFICATION
   6.1 Service Provider Warranties.
       6.1.1 Performance Warranty. Service Provider represents and warrants that the Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner in accordance with industry standards and the specifications set forth in the applicable SOW.
       6.1.2 Non-Infringement. Service Provider further represents that any Deliverables provided do not infringe upon any intellectual property rights of any third party.
   6.2 Client Warranties. Client represents and warrants that (a) it has the authority to enter into this Agreement, (b) all information provided to Service Provider for use in connection with the Services is accurate and complete, and (c) its execution of this Agreement does not violate any contract or obligation to which it is bound.
   6.3 Indemnification.
       6.3.1 Service Provider Indemnification. Service Provider shall indemnify and hold harmless Client, its affiliates, and their respective officers, directors, and employees from and against any and all claims, liabilities, losses, damages, costs, or expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or related to (a) any breach by Service Provider of any representation or warranty under this Agreement, or (b) any claim that the Deliverables or Services infringe upon any intellectual property rights of any third party.
       6.3.2 Client Indemnification. Client shall indemnify and hold harmless Service Provider, its officers, directors, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, liabilities, losses, damages, costs, or expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or related to (a) any breach by Client of any representation or warranty under this Agreement, or (b) any claims by third parties arising from Client’s use of the Deliverables or information provided by Client.
   6.4 Limitation of Liability. In no event shall either Party be liable to the other for any consequential, incidental, punitive, or special damages arising out of this Agreement, whether in contract, tort, or otherwise, even if advised of the possibility of such damages. Except for liability arising from indemnification obligations or breaches of confidentiality, the total aggregate liability of either Party under this Agreement shall not exceed the total Fees paid or payable under the applicable SOW in the twelve (12) months preceding the event giving rise to liability.

7. DISPUTE RESOLUTION AND GOVERNING LAW
   7.1 Negotiation and Mediation. In the event of any dispute, controversy, or claim arising out of or relating to this Agreement (a “Dispute”), the Parties shall first attempt to resolve the Dispute through informal negotiations. If the Dispute remains unresolved after thirty (30) days of good faith negotiations, the Parties agree to attempt to resolve the Dispute through mediation in accordance with rules mutually agreed upon by the Parties.
   7.2 Arbitration. If mediation does not resolve the Dispute within sixty (60) days of the commencement of mediation, the Dispute shall be finally resolved by binding arbitration in New York, NY, in accordance with the commercial arbitration rules of the American Arbitration Association. The arbitrator’s award shall be final and binding on the Parties, and judgment on the award may be entered in any court having jurisdiction.
   7.3 Governing Law. This Agreement and all matters arising hereunder shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of the State of New York without regard to its conflict of laws rules.
   7.4 Jurisdiction. Each Party submits to the exclusive jurisdiction of the state and federal courts located in New York County, New York, for any actions or proceedings arising out of or related to this Agreement, except as otherwise provided in Section 7.2.

8. TERM AND TERMINATION
   8.1 Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and continue for a period of two (2) years, unless terminated earlier in accordance with this Section 8 or extended by mutual written agreement.
   8.2 Termination for Convenience. Either Party may terminate this Agreement or any applicable SOW for convenience upon providing ninety (90) days’ written notice to the other Party. In the event of termination for convenience, Client shall pay Service Provider for all Services performed and expenses incurred up to the effective termination date.
   8.3 Termination for Cause. Either Party may terminate this Agreement or any applicable SOW immediately upon written notice if the other Party (a) commits a material breach of any term or condition of this Agreement or the SOW, and such breach remains uncured for a period of thirty (30) days following written notice specifying the breach; or (b) becomes insolvent, makes an assignment for the benefit of creditors, or is subject to any bankruptcy or similar proceeding.
   8.4 Effects of Termination.
       8.4.1 Upon Termination, Service Provider shall immediately cease work under this Agreement and all SOWs.
       8.4.2 Notwithstanding termination, the rights and obligations under Sections 5 (Confidentiality and Intellectual Property), 6 (Warranties, Representations and Indemnification), 7 (Dispute Resolution and Governing Law), 9 (Limitation of Liability), and any other provisions which by their nature are intended to survive termination, shall survive the termination of this Agreement.
       8.4.3 Client shall pay for all Services and approved expenses incurred as of the effective termination date on a pro rata basis, calculated consistent with the terms set forth in the applicable SOW.
   8.5 Transition Assistance. If requested by Client during the Term or after termination, Service Provider shall provide reasonable assistance to Client for the transition of the Services to either Client or a third party, under mutually agreeable terms and rates.

9. MISCELLANEOUS
   9.1 Independent Contractors. The relationship between the Parties shall be that of independent contractors. Nothing in this Agreement shall be interpreted to create a joint venture, partnership, or agency relationship between the Parties.
   9.2 Assignment. Neither Party may assign or transfer this Agreement, in whole or in part, without the prior written consent of the other Party, except that Service Provider may assign this Agreement in connection with a merger, acquisition, or sale of substantially all of its assets without Client’s consent, provided that the assignee assumes all obligations under this Agreement.
   9.3 Notices. All notices or communications required or permitted under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed given when (a) delivered personally; (b) sent by registered or certified mail, return receipt requested; or (c) sent by a recognized overnight courier service, to the addresses set forth at the beginning of this Agreement or to such other address as a Party may designate by notice in writing.
   9.4 Entire Agreement; Amendment. This Agreement, including all Agreement Documents, constitutes the entire agreement between the Parties with respect to the subject matter hereof, and supersedes all prior and contemporaneous understandings or agreements, whether written or oral. Any amendment or modification of this Agreement must be in writing and duly executed by both Parties.
   9.5 Severability. If any provision of this Agreement is found to be invalid or unenforceable by a court of competent jurisdiction, the remainder of this Agreement shall remain in full force and effect. The Parties agree to negotiate in good faith a substitute provision that most nearly reflects the Parties’ original intent.
   9.6 Waiver. No waiver of any right under this Agreement shall be deemed a waiver of any subsequent breach or default. A waiver of any breach will only be effective if in writing and signed by the Party waiving its right.
   9.7 Force Majeure. Neither Party shall be liable for any failure to perform any obligation under this Agreement if the failure is due to a Force Majeure Event, provided that the affected Party promptly notifies the other Party and endeavors to resume performance as soon as practicable.
   9.8 Publicity. Neither Party shall issue any press release or public statement regarding this Agreement or the nature of the relationship without the prior written consent of the other Party, except as may be required by law or regulatory authority.
   9.9 Counterparts and Electronic Signatures. This Agreement may be executed in multiple counterparts, each of which shall be deemed an original. The Parties agree that signatures delivered by facsimile, electronic means, or scanned and emailed copies shall be deemed effective.
   9.10 Survival. The survival of certain sections, including but not limited to Sections 5, 6, 7, 8.4, 9.2, 9.3, 9.4, 9.7, and 9.10, is intended and shall survive any termination or expiration of this Agreement.
   9.11 Headings. Section headings are inserted for convenience only and shall not affect the interpretation of this Agreement.
   9.12 Interpretation. In the event of any ambiguity, the language of the Agreement shall be interpreted in a manner that best effectuates the intent of the Parties as expressed herein.

RESIDENTIAL LEASE AGREEMENT

THIS RESIDENTIAL LEASE AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of the 1st day of May, 2023 (“Effective Date”), by and between:

Landlord: John A. Doe, whose mailing address is 123 Main Street, Anytown, State 12345 (“Landlord”), and

Tenant: Jane B. Smith, whose mailing address is 789 Oak Avenue, Othertown, State 67890 (“Tenant”).

Each of Landlord and Tenant may be referred to herein individually as a “Party” or collectively as the “Parties.”

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Landlord is the owner of the residential premises described below (the “Premises”); and

WHEREAS, Tenant desires to lease the Premises from Landlord upon the terms and conditions set forth herein; and

WHEREAS, Landlord is willing to lease the Premises to Tenant in accordance with these terms.

NOW, THEREFORE, for and in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants contained herein, the sufficiency of which is acknowledged, the Parties hereto agree as follows:

1. DEFINITIONS AND INTERPRETATIONS
   1.1. “Agreement” means this Residential Lease Agreement including all schedules, exhibits, addenda, and amendments hereto.
   1.2. “Premises” means the residential rental property located at 456 Elm Street, Unit 2B, Hometown, State 54321, together with any inclusive common areas as described herein.
   1.3. “Term” means the lease period commencing on May 1, 2023 and terminating on April 30, 2024, unless sooner terminated pursuant to Section 11 herein.
   1.4. “Rent” means the monthly rental amount specified in Section 3.1.
   1.5. “Late Fee” means the fee assessed if Rent is not received pursuant to Section 3.3.
   1.6. “Security Deposit” means the payment defined in Section 4.1.
   1.7. “Utilities” means the services and supplies relating to electricity, water, gas, sewage, garbage collection, telephone, cable television, internet and any similar service or supply.
   1.8. “Force Majeure” means any event or circumstance beyond a Party’s reasonable control and not caused by the negligence or willful misconduct of any Party, including but not limited to natural disasters, wars, acts of terrorism, labor disputes, acts or orders of governmental authorities.
   1.9. In this Agreement, unless the context requires otherwise, singular words shall include their plural forms and vice versa, and any reference to a “section” is intended to refer to a numbered section within this Agreement.

2. DESCRIPTION OF THE PREMISES
   2.1. The Premises consist of a single-family residence comprising three bedrooms, two full bathrooms, one half-bath, a living room, kitchen, dining area, and attached garage.
   2.2. The Premises form part of a larger residential community with managed common areas including but not limited to landscaped gardens, recreational playgrounds, and a community pool. Tenant shall have the right to access these common areas in accordance with the rules and regulations established by Landlord.
   2.3. Any personal property provided by Landlord for Tenant’s use (e.g., refrigerator, washer, dryer) remains part of the Premises and shall be maintained as set forth in Section 6 herein.

3. TERM, RENTAL PAYMENT, AND PAYMENT TERMS
   3.1. Term
       a. The initial term of this Agreement shall be for a period of twelve (12) months commencing May 1, 2023 (“Commencement Date”) and ending on April 30, 2024 (“Expiration Date”).
       b. This Agreement may be extended upon mutual written consent by both Parties.
   3.2. Rent Amount and Payment Schedule
       a. The total Rent shall be $1,500 per month.
       b. Rent is due on the 1st day of each calendar month (“Due Date”) and must be paid no later than 5:00 p.m. on the Due Date.
       c. Payment shall be made by Tenant by check, money order, or electronic transfer to the account designated in writing by Landlord.
   3.3. Late Payment and Returned Payment Fees
       a. Should Tenant fail to pay Rent by the Due Date, a Late Fee of 5% of the amount due will be assessed for each day Rent is late, up to a maximum of 25% of the overdue amount.
       b. Any check returned for insufficient funds will incur an additional fee of $50.
       c. In the event Rent is not received within five (5) days after the Due Date, Tenant shall be subject to additional enforcement actions as specified in this Agreement.
   3.4. Payment Adjustments and Increases
       a. Any changes to Rent shall be documented in a written amendment to this Agreement and must be agreed upon by both Parties.
       b. Should there be any prorated Rent due for any partial month (for example, if Tenant occupies the Premises for less than a full month on move-in or move-out), the exact amount shall be calculated based on the daily rate derived by dividing the monthly Rent by 30.
   3.5. Application of Payments
       Payments received from Tenant will be first applied to any accrued Late Fees, then to any returned payment fees, and finally to the Rent due.

4. SECURITY DEPOSIT & OTHER FEES
   4.1. Security Deposit
       a. Upon execution of this Agreement, Tenant shall deposit with Landlord the sum of $1,500 (“Security Deposit”) as security for the faithful performance of all obligations under this Agreement.
       b. The Security Deposit shall be held in an interest-bearing account by Landlord, if required by applicable law, and interest shall accrue thereon in accordance with state law.
   4.2. Use of Security Deposit
       a. Landlord may apply all or a portion of the Security Deposit toward any unpaid Rent, damages to the Premises beyond normal wear and tear, or any other amounts owed by Tenant under this Agreement.
       b. Tenant shall not be entitled to any setoff or deduction from the Security Deposit based on the Landlord’s errors or omissions.
   4.3. Return of Security Deposit
       a. Within thirty (30) days following Tenant’s vacating of the Premises and termination of this Agreement, Landlord shall return the Security Deposit minus any lawful and itemized deductions.
       b. Any deductions shall be documented and an itemized statement provided to Tenant, including receipts for any repairs, shall be attached.
   4.4. Additional Fees
       a. If Tenant requests any services not originally included in this Agreement (such as additional cleaning services or facility enhancements) the cost of such services shall be billed separately and payable within ten (10) days of invoicing.

5. USE OF PREMISES AND OCCUPANCY
   5.1. Permitted Use
       a. The Premises shall be used solely for residential purposes by Tenant and Tenant’s immediate family. Prohibited uses include any commercial, business, or unlawful activity.
       b. Tenant agrees not to engage in any behavior that disturbs the peace and quiet of the building and/or the surrounding neighborhood.
   5.2. Occupancy Limits
       a. The maximum number of persons who may reside in the Premises shall be limited to no more than five (5) occupants.
       b. Any additional occupants beyond the stated limit must be approved in writing by Landlord and may be subject to additional fees or conditions.
   5.3. Tenant Responsibilities
       a. Tenant shall maintain the Premises in a clean, sanitary, and safe condition at all times.
       b. Tenant shall comply with all applicable local, state, and federal laws, including any homeowner association (HOA) rules or community guidelines as communicated by Landlord.
       c. Tenant agrees not to make any alterations, modifications, or improvements to the Premises without the prior written consent of Landlord.
   5.4. Subleasing and Assignment
       a. Tenant may not sublease, assign, or otherwise transfer any interest in the Premises without the express prior written consent of Landlord. Consent, if granted, may be subject to additional terms and conditions.
       b. Any violation of this provision shall be deemed a default under this Agreement and may result in immediate termination as provided in Section 11 herein.

6. MAINTENANCE, REPAIRS, AND ALTERATIONS
   6.1. Landlord’s Responsibilities
       a. Landlord shall maintain the Premises in a habitable and safe condition and shall be responsible for repairs to the structural elements, roof, plumbing, heating, air conditioning, and electrical systems unless damage is caused by Tenant or Tenant’s guests.
       b. Landlord shall have the right to enter the Premises at reasonable hours for purposes of inspection, to make necessary repairs, or to show the Premises to prospective tenants or purchasers after providing Tenant with at least twenty-four (24) hours written notice, except in emergencies.
   6.2. Tenant’s Responsibilities
       a. Tenant shall immediately notify Landlord in writing of any needed repairs or unsafe conditions that require the attention of professionals.
       b. Tenant is responsible for maintaining the Premises in a clean and orderly condition and for all damage resulting from Tenant’s negligence or misuse.
       c. Tenant agrees to routinely service and maintain appliances and any provided personal property as directed by Landlord.
   6.3. Unauthorized Alterations
       a. Tenant shall not paint, install fixtures, or otherwise alter the Premises without obtaining prior written authorization from Landlord.
       b. Any approved alterations shall become the property of the Landlord upon expiration or termination of this Agreement, unless otherwise agreed in writing.
   6.4. Landscaping and Exterior Maintenance
       a. Tenant shall be permitted to maintain small garden areas on the Premises as long as such maintenance does not interfere with the overall aesthetic or structural integrity of the property.
       b. Major landscaping or exterior modifications shall be conducted by Landlord or an approved contractor.

7. INSURANCE, LIABILITY, AND INDEMNIFICATION
   7.1. Tenant’s Insurance
       a. Tenant is encouraged to maintain renters’ insurance to cover personal property damage and liability. Landlord shall not be responsible for any loss or damage to Tenant’s personal property.
       b. Tenant shall provide proof of insurance upon request.
   7.2. Landlord’s Insurance
       a. Landlord shall maintain property insurance covering the building and any provided personal property. Such insurance does not extend to Tenant’s personal property.
   7.3. Liability
       a. Neither Party shall be liable to the other for any indirect, incidental, or consequential damages arising from this Agreement or the use of the Premises.
       b. Tenant agrees to hold Landlord harmless from any claims, losses, liabilities, or expenses arising from Tenant’s use of the Premises except in cases of Landlord’s gross negligence or willful misconduct.
   7.4. Indemnification
       a. Tenant shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Landlord from and against any and all claims arising from Tenant’s use of the Premises, any breach by Tenant of this Agreement, or any violation of law, provided that such claims do not arise from Landlord’s gross negligence.

8. UTILITIES AND SERVICES
   8.1. Payment of Utilities
       a. Tenant shall be solely responsible for the payment of all Utilities used on the Premises including, but not limited to, electricity, gas, water, sewer, trash collection, and any cable or internet services unless expressly stated otherwise in writing.
       b. Tenant agrees to establish accounts for each Utility service in their name and ensure continuous payment and service without interruption.
   8.2. Utility Disruptions
       a. In the event of Utility service interruptions not caused by Tenant’s actions, Tenant is required to notify Landlord immediately.
       b. Landlord shall take all reasonable steps to assist Tenant in resolving Utility issues caused by external factors or infrastructure failures.
   8.3. Service Charges
       a. Should Tenant fail to pay for Utilities timely, Landlord reserves the right to pay for such services on Tenant’s behalf and charge Tenant for the full amount plus an administrative fee as specified in additional addenda or notices.

9. RULES, REGULATIONS, AND COMMUNITY GUIDELINES
   9.1. Compliance with Laws and Regulations
       a. Tenant agrees to abide by all applicable local, state, and federal laws and regulations regarding occupancy, health, safety, and sanitation.
       b. Tenant further agrees to comply with any homeowners’ association rules, community guidelines, or building policies as may be provided by Landlord.
   9.2. Prohibited Conduct
       a. Tenant shall refrain from any activity that disturbs other occupants, including excessive noise, vandalism, or any other behavior that may cause harm or inconvenience.
       b. Tenant shall not use the Premises for any unlawful purpose, including but not limited to drug-related activities or unauthorized commercial enterprises.
   9.3. Amendments to Rules
       a. Landlord reserves the right to amend, modify, or add to the rules and regulations governing the use of common areas or the Premises provided that Tenant is given written notice of any such changes at least thirty (30) days prior to adoption.

10. DISPUTE RESOLUTION
   10.1. Mediation
       a. In the event of any dispute or controversy arising out of or relating to this Agreement, the Parties agree to first attempt to resolve the matter amicably through mutual consultation. Should the Parties fail to reach a resolution within fifteen (15) days, they agree to submit the dispute to mediation before initiating litigation.
       b. The mediation shall be conducted by a mutually agreed-upon mediator with expertise in residential rental matters.
   10.2. Arbitration
       a. If mediation does not result in a resolution within thirty (30) days from the time of initiation, then any unresolved dispute shall be submitted to final and binding arbitration in accordance with the rules of the American Arbitration Association.
       b. The arbitration shall be conducted in the county where the Premises are located, and the decision rendered by the arbitrator shall be final and enforceable in any court of competent jurisdiction.
   10.3. Costs
       a. Each Party shall bear its own costs and expenses incurred during the dispute resolution process, except that the costs of the mediator or arbitrator may be shared equally unless otherwise agreed upon in writing.

11. TERMINATION AND DEFAULT
   11.1. Termination by Tenant
       a. Tenant may terminate this Agreement prior to the Expiration Date only if Tenant provides Landlord with written notice of termination at least sixty (60) days in advance.
       b. In such cases, Tenant shall remain liable for Rent and any other charges until the end of the notice period.
   11.2. Termination by Landlord
       a. Landlord may terminate this Agreement if Tenant materially violates any terms of this Agreement and fails to cure such default within ten (10) days following written notice specifying the nature of the default.
       b. Material violations include, but are not limited to, non-payment of Rent, unauthorized subleasing, causing damage to the Premises, or engaging in unlawful activities.
   11.3. Automatic Termination
       a. This Agreement shall automatically terminate on the Expiration Date unless renewed by mutual written consent of the Parties.
       b. Upon termination or expiration, Tenant shall surrender possession of the Premises to Landlord in the same condition as received except for reasonable wear and tear as further detailed in Section 12.
   11.4. Remedies and Damages
       a. In the event of termination for default, Landlord may pursue all remedies available under law, including seeking monetary damages and injunctive relief.
       b. The termination of this Agreement shall not relieve Tenant of any liability for Rent or other charges incurred prior to termination.

   12.1. Tenant Move-Out Procedures
       a. Tenant shall provide Landlord with written notice of Tenant’s intent to vacate the Premises in accordance with Section 11.1.
       b. Prior to vacating, Tenant shall remove all personal property and return all keys, access cards, and other items provided by Landlord.

       a. Landlord shall conduct a final inspection of the Premises upon Tenant’s vacating. Tenant shall be present if possible.

       a. Tenant agrees to repair any damages caused by negligence or misuse. Costs incurred by Landlord to repair such damages will be deducted from the Security Deposit.
       b. Tenant shall be responsible for any repairs necessitated by Tenant’s failure to comply with the terms of this Agreement.

PURCHASE AGREEMENT

This PURCHASE AGREEMENT (“Agreement”) is made and entered into as of June 1, 2023 (the “Effective Date”), by and between Global Manufacturing Solutions, Inc., a corporation organized and existing under the laws of the State of Delaware with its principal place of business at 123 Commerce Way, Wilmington, Delaware (“Seller”), and United Distributors, LLC, a limited liability company duly organized under the laws of the State of New York with its principal place of business at 789 Market Street, New York, New York (“Buyer”). Seller and Buyer shall hereinafter be referred to individually as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

RECITALS

WHEREAS, Seller is engaged in the distribution and sale of manufacturing and industrial products and possesses the requisite expertise and inventory to supply the Products (as defined below) to Buyer; and

WHEREAS, Buyer desires to purchase and Seller desires to sell such Products pursuant to the terms and conditions set forth herein; and

WHEREAS, the Parties desire to set forth clearly, through a comprehensive and consistent agreement, their mutual rights, obligations, and understandings with respect to the sale and purchase of the Products.

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants, agreements, and representations contained herein, and for other good and valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

────────────────────────────────────────────
1. DEFINITIONS
────────────────────────────────────────────

1.1 “Agreement Documents” means this Purchase Agreement, any addenda, schedules, exhibits, attachments, amendments, and any documents incorporated by reference herein.

1.2 “Business Day” means any day other than a Saturday, Sunday, or a day on which banks in New York or Delaware are authorized or required by law to close.

1.3 “Closing Date” means the date on which the transactions contemplated herein are consummated, which shall occur no later than July 15, 2023, unless otherwise mutually agreed by the Parties in writing.

1.4 “Confidential Information” means any and all technical and non-technical information disclosed by one Party (the “Discloser”) to the other Party (the “Recipient”) in connection with or arising out of this Agreement that is designated as confidential or that reasonably should be understood to be confidential, including without limitation trade secrets, know-how, research, product plans, products, services, customer lists, organizations, business plans, strategies, and any other proprietary information.

1.5 “Force Majeure Event” means any cause beyond a Party’s reasonable control, including, but not limited to, acts of God, war, terrorism, riots, natural disasters, epidemics or pandemics, labor disputes, or any other events that prevent or delay performance under this Agreement.

1.6 “Products” means the industrial components, manufacturing machinery, and related accessories listed in Schedule A, which is annexed hereto and made a part hereof.

1.7 “Purchase Price” means the total amount to be paid by Buyer to Seller for the Products as set forth in Section 3 below, together with any applicable taxes, fees, or charges as provided herein.

1.8 “Warranty Period” means a period of twelve (12) months commencing on the Delivery Date (as defined in Section 4) during which Seller’s warranty obligations under Section 7 shall apply.

────────────────────────────────────────────
2. SALE AND PURCHASE OF PRODUCTS
────────────────────────────────────────────

2.1 Sale and Purchase. Subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, Seller agrees to sell, assign, and transfer to Buyer, and Buyer agrees to purchase and accept from Seller, the Products specified in Schedule A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.

2.2 Scope of Products. The Products shall consist of the items, goods, and related components manufactured by Seller, in conformity with the specifications set forth in Schedule A. Any additional products requested by Buyer that are not listed in Schedule A shall be subject to a separate written agreement between the Parties.

2.3 Modifications. Any modifications or amendments to Schedule A or any other term of this Agreement must be in writing and signed by both Parties. All such modifications shall be subject to the same terms and obligations as the original terms of the Agreement unless expressly provided otherwise.

────────────────────────────────────────────
3. PURCHASE PRICE AND PAYMENT TERMS
────────────────────────────────────────────

3.1 Purchase Price. The aggregate Purchase Price for the Products shall be Four Hundred Fifty Thousand United States Dollars (US $450,000), subject to adjustment as provided in Section 3.5. The Purchase Price is exclusive of any applicable federal, state, local, or other taxes, customs duties, or charges, which if applicable shall be borne by Buyer.

3.2 Payment Terms. Buyer shall pay the Purchase Price in accordance with the following schedule:
  a. An initial deposit of Ten Percent (10%) of the Purchase Price, equaling US $45,000, shall be paid by Buyer within five (5) Business Days of the Effective Date.
  b. The remaining balance of Three Hundred One Thousand Five Hundred United States Dollars (US $405,000) shall be payable as follows:
     i. Fifty Percent (50%) of the remaining balance (i.e., US $202,500) shall be paid by Buyer no later than the Closing Date.
     ii. The balance of the remaining fifty percent (US $202,500) shall be paid within thirty (30) calendar days after the Delivery Date (as defined in Section 4).

3.3 Payment Method. All payments under this Agreement shall be made by electronic funds transfer, wire transfer, or such other method as mutually agreed by the Parties in writing. Payment instructions shall be provided by Seller in writing prior to any scheduled payment date.

3.4 Late Payment. If Buyer fails to make any payment when due under this Agreement, Seller may, at its option, assess a late fee of 1.5% per month (or the highest rate permitted by applicable law) on any overdue balance, calculated from the due date until the date of actual payment.

3.5 Adjustments to the Purchase Price. Any adjustment to the Purchase Price as mutually agreed upon in writing shall be documented by amending Schedule A with precise reference to the specific items affected, together with updated pricing and quantities, and shall be consistent throughout this Agreement.

────────────────────────────────────────────
4. DELIVERY, TITLE, AND RISK OF LOSS
────────────────────────────────────────────

4.1 Delivery Schedule. Seller shall deliver the Products to Buyer’s designated facility at 789 Market Street, New York, New York no later than July 31, 2023, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Parties. Time is of the essence in this Agreement.

4.2 Delivery Method. Delivery shall be made by Seller’s chosen carrier, subject to any special delivery instructions provided by Buyer. Seller shall notify Buyer at least 48 hours in advance of the scheduled shipment.

4.3 Risk of Loss and Title. Risk of loss or damage to the Products shall pass to Buyer upon Seller’s delivery of the Products to the designated carrier at Seller’s facility. Title to the Products shall remain with Seller until full payment of the Purchase Price is received by Seller, at which point title will pass to Buyer.

4.4 Inspection and Acceptance. Buyer shall have the right to inspect the Products upon delivery. If any Products are nonconforming or defective, Buyer must notify Seller in writing within five (5) Business Days of receipt. Failure to notify within such period shall constitute acceptance of the Products.

5. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES

────────────────────────────────────────────

  a. Seller shall manufacture, package, and ship the Products in compliance with all applicable laws, regulations, and industry standards.

  a. Buyer agrees to pay the Purchase Price in strict accordance with Section 3.
  b. Buyer agrees to provide Seller with timely and accurate delivery directions and any additional information reasonably required to effectuate delivery.
  c. Buyer shall cooperate with Seller in the resolution of any disputes regarding nonconforming or defective Products by providing prompt written notice and detailed descriptions of the issues.

────────────────────────────────────────────
7. WARRANTY AND REMEDIES
────────────────────────────────────────────

Seller warrants that the Products shall (i) substantially conform to the specifications contained in Schedule A and (ii) be free from defects in material and workmanship for the Warranty Period. If any Product does not meet these warranties, Seller’s sole obligation and Buyer’s exclusive remedy shall be for Seller, at its option, to repair or replace the defective Products or refund the Purchase Price paid for such defective Products.

7.2 Exclusions. The warranty does not cover defects or damage arising from:
  a. Misuse, neglect, or accident by Buyer or any third party;
  b. Modifications or alterations not performed by Seller;
  c. Use of the Products in a manner for which they were not intended;
  d. Normal wear and tear or cosmetic damage that does not affect functionality.

Seller shall have the right to inspect the affected Products and determine, in its sole discretion, whether repair, replacement, or refund is appropriate.

────────────────────────────────────────────
8. CONDITIONS PRECEDENT AND CLOSING
────────────────────────────────────────────

8.1 Conditions Precedent. The obligations of both Parties under this Agreement are subject to the satisfaction of the following conditions precedent:
  a. Buyer’s payment of the initial deposit as specified in Section 3.2(a).
  b. Seller’s delivery of all documentation and certifications required under Section 4.3.
  c. Buyer’s receipt of all necessary import licenses or permits (if applicable) required by law for the receipt of the Products.

8.2 Closing. On or before the Closing Date, the Parties shall execute and deliver any and all documents necessary to transfer the Products as provided herein. At the Closing:
  a. Seller shall deliver the Product shipment accompanied by the appropriate shipping documents and a certificate of compliance confirming that the Products conform to Schedule A.
  b. Buyer shall make the payment as stipulated in Section 3.2(b)(i) for the Products.

8.3 Post-Closing Obligations. Within ten (10) Business Days following the Closing Date, any remaining documentation required to perfect title shall be promptly executed and delivered by the Parties. The obligations set forth in this Section 8 shall survive the Closing.

9. INDEMNIFICATION
────────────────────────────────────────────

9.1 Seller’s Indemnification. Seller shall indemnify, defend, and hold harmless Buyer and its affiliates, directors, officers, employees, and agents from and against any and all claims, liabilities, losses, damages, costs, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of or relating to:
  a. Any breach by Seller of any representation, warranty, or covenant contained in this Agreement;
  b. Any defect in the Products that results in property damage or bodily injury;

  c. Buyer’s negligence or willful misconduct in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement.

────────────────────────────────────────────

────────────────────────────────────────────

1. DEFINITIONS
   1.1. "Confidential Information" means all non-public information disclosed by either Party, whether written, oral or recorded in any form, including but not limited to business strategies, financial data, trade secrets, recipes, client lists, or other proprietary information. For the avoidance of doubt, Confidential Information does not include information that (i) is or becomes generally available to the public other than as a result of a breach of this Agreement; (ii) was rightfully in the possession of the receiving Party prior to disclosure by the disclosing Party; or (iii) is received by the receiving Party on a non-confidential basis from a third party.
   1.2. "Deliverables" refers to the documents, software, reports, analyses, and other tangible results prepared by CONSULTANT pursuant to the scope of work described herein.
   1.3. "Project Milestones" are the pre-agreed phases and deadlines for the completion of key portions of the Services as specified in Exhibit A attached hereto.
   1.4. "Intellectual Property" means any inventions, discoveries, improvements, developments, trade secrets, and any other work product, including copyrightable or patentable materials, resulting from or related in any way to the performance of the Services.
   1.5. "Term" shall have the meaning set forth in Section 3.

2. SCOPE OF SERVICES
   2.1. CONSULTANT Responsibilities: CONSULTANT shall provide CLIENT with advice and assistance in strategic planning, market analysis, and financial management. This shall include reviewing internal protocols, conducting on-site evaluations, furnishing recommendations for cost efficiencies, and, where deemed beneficial, providing training modules for CLIENT personnel.
   2.2. CLIENT Responsibilities: CLIENT agrees to provide CONSULTANT access to necessary company records, relevant personnel, and facilities as reasonably required to carry out the Services. CLIENT shall also designate a project liaison to coordinate the timely exchange of information.
   2.3. Additional Tasks: Notwithstanding the general description above, CONSULTANT shall also endeavor to integrate strategic advice into daily operational practices and, subject to further agreement in writing, may also assist in client-facing negotiations. Such integration, however, shall in no event conflict with the independent consultancy role assigned to CONSULTANT as set forth herein.
   2.4. Adjustments: The Parties agree that any modifications to the scope of Services must be made in writing and amended in an addendum to this Agreement signed by both Parties.

3. TERM AND TERMINATION
   3.1. Initial Term: The Agreement shall be in effect from February 1, 2023 (Effective Date) until January 31, 2024 (the "Initial Term").
   3.2. Extension: Upon written mutual agreement, the term may be extended for additional periods not exceeding one year each. In a separate section (see Section 6.3 on Payment Schedules), the performance period for certain milestones is defined to continue beyond February 1, 2024 and up to February 1, 2025.
   3.3. Termination for Convenience: Either Party may terminate this Agreement upon providing thirty (30) days written notice to the other Party. Notwithstanding, termination for convenience pursuant to Section 3.3 shall not affect deadlines for Work already commenced as set forth in Exhibit A.
   3.4. Termination for Cause: Either Party may terminate this Agreement immediately if the other Party breaches any material term, and such breach is not cured within fifteen (15) days after written notice is provided. In the event of termination for cause, CLIENT shall pay CONSULTANT for all Services adequately performed through the effective date of termination.
   3.5. Conflicting Deadline Note: While Section 3.1 sets the contract’s duration ending on January 31, 2024, Section 6.3 and the Project Milestones in Exhibit A reference key deliverable deadlines extending to February 1, 2025. This is intended to reflect differing operational timelines but may require further management interpretation if contractual performance extends into the extended milestone period.

4. PAYMENT TERMS
   4.1. Consulting Fee: CLIENT shall pay CONSULTANT a fee based on two different models:
       (a) Hourly Rate: An hourly rate of $150 for all consulting services rendered on a time-and-material basis; and
       (b) Fixed Fee: A lump-sum fee of $200,000 for the completion of the agreed Project Milestones in Exhibit A.
       The Parties acknowledge that these models are intended to cover different aspects of the Services, with the hourly rate applying primarily to advisory meetings and additional research, and the fixed fee covering strategic deliverable development. However, Consultant shall not bill concurrently for both models on the same work products.
   4.2. Payment Schedule: Payments under the Hourly Rate model shall be invoiced monthly, payable within thirty (30) days of receipt of invoice. Payments under the Fixed Fee arrangement shall be made in installments according to the Project Milestone achievement schedule set forth in Exhibit A.
   4.3. Late Payment and Penalties: If any payment is not received within thirty (30) days, CLIENT shall incur a penalty fee of 1.5% per month on the outstanding balance. However, Section 6.3 sets a different interpretation of payment due dates with some installments explicitly defined as payable upon milestone acceptance, which may lead to ambiguity in calculating late penalties.
   4.4. Reimbursable Expenses: CLIENT shall reimburse CONSULTANT for all reasonable out-of-pocket expenses incurred in connection with providing the Services, provided such expenses have been pre-approved in writing by CLIENT.
   4.5. Contradictory Remuneration Terms: The dual payment structure (hourly versus fixed fee) is designed to provide flexibility; however, the separate installment framework in Section 6.3 for milestone achievements may lead to confusion regarding which fee structure applies to overlapping services provided within the same time period.

5. PROJECT MILESTONES AND REPORTING
   5.1. Milestone Schedule: Detailed Project Milestones, including deliverable deadlines, performance criteria, and quality benchmarks, are detailed in Exhibit A attached hereto and incorporated herein by reference.
   5.2. Deliverable Acceptance: CLIENT shall have seven (7) days from receipt of any Deliverable to provide written acceptance or a list of discrepancies, upon which CONSULTANT shall have fifteen (15) days to correct such discrepancies to achieve final acceptance.
   5.3. Reporting: CONSULTANT shall submit progress reports on a bi-weekly basis, which shall include a summary of work performed, upcoming milestone targets, and any issues impacting performance. In the event of conflicting deadlines between this reporting cycle and the deadlines included in Exhibit A (particularly when milestones extend beyond the Initial Term), the milestone schedule shall take precedence for deliverable acceptance.

6. MILESTONE-BASED PAYMENT SCHEDULE
   6.1. Payment on Milestone Completion: For the Fixed Fee arrangement, payments shall be triggered upon CLIENT’s written acceptance of each milestone as detailed in Exhibit A.
   6.2. Payment Adjustments: Should a milestone not be met as per the agreed timeline, CLIENT reserves the right to deduct 5% of the milestone fee per week of delay, up to a maximum of 20%. However, Section 4.3’s monthly invoicing mechanism may conflict with these deductions for overlap periods.
   6.3. Extended Performance Period: For certain advanced deliverables, the performance period extends to February 1, 2025, which stands in contrast with the overall Agreement Term specified in Section 3.1. This extension is provided to cover long-term strategic planning requirements, though it may expose the Parties to uncertainty regarding the termination of the Agreement.

7. INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY
   7.1. Ownership of Deliverables: All right, title, and interest in and to the Deliverables, including the Intellectual Property contained therein, shall be vested in CLIENT, subject to an irrevocable, worldwide, royalty-free, perpetual license to CONSULTANT for non-commercial internal purposes only.
   7.2. Pre-Existing Materials: CONSULTANT shall retain ownership of any pre-existing intellectual property. However, CLIENT shall receive an exclusive license to use such pre-existing materials, which is limited solely to the term of this Agreement.
   7.3. Consultant’s Work Products: Notwithstanding Section 7.1, CONSULTANT retains all rights to methodologies and proprietary learning or techniques that are used in connection with the performance of the Services. The Parties acknowledge that this creates a potential contradiction regarding the ownership of work performed collaboratively versus pre-existing intellectual property.
   7.4. Contradictory IP Clauses: The above clauses are intended to provide CLIENT with a broad license to use all deliverables while preserving CONSULTANT’s pre-existing rights; however, the language in Section 7.1, when juxtaposed with Section 7.3, may give rise to disputes over the extent of intellectual property rights for jointly-developed content.

8. CONFIDENTIALITY
   8.1. Obligation: Each Party agrees to hold Confidential Information in strict confidence and not disclose it to third parties except as required by law or with the other Party’s written consent.
   8.2. Duration of Confidentiality: CLIENT and CONSULTANT agree that confidentiality obligations under this Agreement shall survive for a period of five (5) years following the termination or expiration of this Agreement.
   8.3. Exception: Notwithstanding the foregoing, Section 9.4 (Return of Materials) below provides that all confidentiality obligations shall expire one (1) year after termination, unless otherwise required by statute or mutually agreed in writing, thereby creating potential ambiguity regarding the post-termination confidentiality period.
   8.4. Permitted Disclosures: If disclosure is required by law, the disclosing Party shall provide prompt written notice to the other Party in order to allow the other Party to seek a protective order or other remedy.

9. REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES
   9.1. CONSULTANT Representations: CONSULTANT represents and warrants that:
       (a) It has the necessary expertise, experience, and licenses to provide the Services;
       (b) The performance of the Services does not conflict with any other obligations or contractual commitments;
       (c) All Services will be performed in a professional and workmanlike manner, conforming to generally accepted industry standards; and
       (d) It shall abide by all applicable laws and regulations.
   9.2. CLIENT Representations: CLIENT represents and warrants that:
       (a) It possesses the authority to enter into this Agreement;
       (b) It shall provide all necessary information and resources to enable CONSULTANT to perform the Services; and
       (c) It shall operate in compliance with all relevant statutory and regulatory requirements.
   9.3. No Implied Warranties: Except as expressly provided herein, neither Party makes any warranties, express or implied, regarding any matter.
   9.4. Return of Materials: Upon termination or expiration of this Agreement, each Party shall return or destroy the other Party’s Confidential Information. However, due to the contradictory language in Section 8.3 regarding the duration of confidentiality, the moment and manner of such return may be subject to interpretation.

10. INDEMNIFICATION AND LIMITATION OF LIABILITY
   10.1. Mutual Indemnification: Each Party agrees to indemnify, defend, and hold harmless the other Party, including its officers, directors, employees, and agents, from any and all claims, liabilities, losses, damages, and expenses (including reasonable attorneys’ fees) arising out of any breach of this Agreement or any negligent or intentional act of such Party.
   10.2. Limitation of Liability: In no event shall either Party be liable to the other for any consequential, incidental, indirect, special, or punitive damages, even if advised of the possibility of such damages.
   10.3. Liability Cap: CONSULTANT’s total aggregate liability under this Agreement arising from any claim shall not exceed the total fees paid by CLIENT to CONSULTANT under this Agreement. However, Section 4.3’s penalty mechanisms might in certain circumstances effectively exceed this cap, thereby introducing a potential conflict.
   10.4. Exclusions: Nothing in this Section shall serve to limit or exclude liability for death or personal injury resulting from negligence, or for any breach of confidentiality obligations herein.

11. GOVERNING LAW AND DISPUTE RESOLUTION
   11.1. Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed under the laws of the State of Delaware without regard to its conflicts of law principles.
   11.2. Dispute Resolution: The Parties shall attempt in good faith to resolve any dispute arising under or in connection with this Agreement by negotiation. In the event that a dispute cannot be so resolved, the dispute shall be submitted to binding arbitration under the rules of the American Arbitration Association.
   11.3. Arbitration Venue: Notwithstanding Section 11.1, any arbitration proceedings regarding disputes under this Agreement shall be held in New York City, New York. This contradictory provision between the Governing Law (Section 11.1) and the Arbitration Venue (Section 11.3) may give rise to jurisdictional ambiguity.
   11.4. Choice of Forum: CLIENT and CONSULTANT expressly agree that any court action arising out of or relating to this Agreement shall be brought exclusively in a court of competent jurisdiction in New York, despite the prevailing Governing Law as set forth in Section 11.1. Licensor and Licensee are sometimes individually referred to herein as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties.”

NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the mutual covenants and representations, warranties, and undertakings herein contained, and other valuable consideration, the receipt and sufficiency of which are hereby acknowledged, the Parties agree as follows:

Notwithstanding, the term may at times refer to obligations described in Section 8 which differ in duration.
